title: Charlie Kirk, Conservative Activist, Killed at Utah Event; Suspect in Custody

The incident has heightened concerns about political violence in the United States. Authorities have reported that a suspect is now in custody in connection with the shooting. Kirk, 31, was known for his influential role in engaging young Americans in conservative politics and had played a significant part in political campaigns, including President Trump's return to the White House.

title: Poland Reports 19 Airspace Breaches, Blames Belarus and Russia; NATO Responds
snippets: NATO member Poland said it scrambled defenses in response to 19 airspace breaches. Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk said many of the drones came from Belarus.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMihAFBVV95cUxOUFd1dlpHZ1BCMWNTYU84TVNLOHFnM0I2NjcwN0JJQnExNmxONzJNZldXVnpjX0FmUHhRSHpFdGJWN3BRcTJQa29PMEVQbVpvemNIdWtoMU5Oa1dUY1QwU1JiUGZreXV3OFVIc3BrS3pGNk9UanZucWtVSnkwT0VSejdzMlY?oc=5" target="_blank">Poland, NATO leaders condemn Russian drones in P
Military officials in Poland say the country's airspace was "repeatedly violated by drone-type objects" in the overnight hours amid Russian strikes on targets in Ukraine.

Donald Tusk says Poland dealing with a large-scale provocation after at least 19 violations of Polish airspace

Poland‚Äôs prime minister, Donald Tusk, said the country is closer to military conflict ‚Äúthan at any time since the second world war‚Äù as Warsaw and Nato allies weighed a response to
The military called the breach of Poland‚Äôs airspace ‚Äúunprecedented,‚Äù and it triggered a request by Warsaw to consult with fellow NATO members.
The incursion was the first time alliance planes had engaged enemy targets in NATO airspace. Poland‚Äôs leader called it ‚Äúa large-scale provocation.‚Äù
Poland accused Russia of violating its airspace 19 times overnight, during its bombardment of neighboring Ukraine. Moscow denies the drones are Russian.
Article 4 allows member states to start a formal discussion within the alliance about threats to their security. It does not commit the alliance to military action.
titles: Poland calls NATO meeting after downing Russian drones
Poland, NATO leaders condemn Russian drones in Polish airspace - Axios
WATCH:  NATO downs Russian drones over Poland
Poland ‚Äòcloser to military conflict than at any time since WW2‚Äô as Nato allies weigh response to Russian drones

Poland Has Invoked NATO‚Äôs Article 4. What Comes Next?
summary: Poland reported 19 airspace breaches, attributing many to drones from Belarus, and accused Russia of involvement. This prompted Poland to scramble defenses and consult with NATO, marking the first time NATO planes engaged targets within its airspace. The incidents led to NATO deploying fighter jets to counter what was described as a deliberate provocation. Moscow denies the drones were Russian. The situation triggered discussions under NATO's Article 4 but does not automatically lead to military action.

title: NASA Finds Potential Signs of Ancient Life in Mars Rock Sample
snippets: Ancient organisms may have left microscopic "biosignatures" on Mars. That's according to NASA scientists, who say a rock sample offers the most concrete proof yet that the red planet once hosted life.
The discovery is among the strongest evidence yet that the red planet may have once harbored life. . However, scientists say more study is needed, ideally in labs on Earth.

NASA‚Äôs Perseverance rover has discovered mudstones in Mars‚Äô Jezero Crater that contain organic carbon and unusual textures hinting at possible biosignatures. These findings suggest that ancient Martian environments may have supported chemical processes similar to those on Earth, where microbial life

A sample collected by NASA‚Äôs Perseverance Mars rover from an ancient dry riverbed in Jezero Crater could preserve evidence of ancient microbial life. Taken from a rock named ‚ÄúCheyava Falls‚Äù last year, the sample, called ‚ÄúSapphire Canyon,‚Äù contains poten
titles: Life on Mars? NASA says a rock sample shows potential signs of ancient life
NASA rover discovers potential signs of ancient life on Mars
Life on Mars? NASA discovers potential biosignatures in Martian mudstones
NASA Says Mars Rover Discovered Potential Biosignature Last Year
summary: NASA scientists have discovered a rock sample on Mars, named "Sapphire Canyon," which may contain microscopic "biosignatures" suggesting ancient microbial life. This evidence, collected by the Perseverance rover from an ancient riverbed in Jezero Crater, represents some of the strongest indications of past life on Mars. Further analysis on Earth is required to confirm these findings.

title: Mexico City Gas Tanker Explosion Kills 3, Injures 67; Probe Launched
snippets: An investigation has been launched to determine the cause of the explosion that wounded at least 70 people.

summary: An investigation is underway to find the cause of a gas tanker truck explosion in Mexico City, which killed three people and injured 67, 19 with severe burns. The blast occurred on a busy highway, causing significant chaos. Initial thoughts suggest the explosion was accidental.

title: Astros Edge Blue Jays 3-2 Despite Late Toronto Comeback Attempt
snippets: The Toronto Blue Jays were once again mounting a late comeback on Wednesday night with Andres Gimenez and Nathan Lukes hitting RBI singles in the eighth inning to tie up a game with the Houston Astros 2-2.
Jeff Hoffman’s up-and-down season continued on Wednesday night for the Toronto Blue Jays.
Toronto Blue Jays manager John Schneider discusses the team’s 3-2 loss to the Houston Astros, saying closer Jeff Hoffman’s losing outing really just came down to “one bad pitch” against Yainer Diaz.
titles: Schneider sticks with Hoffman as Blue Jays‚Äô closer

summary: The Toronto Blue Jays lost to the Houston Astros 3-2 on Wednesday. Despite a late comeback attempt with RBI singles from Andres Gimenez and Nathan Lukes in the eighth inning to tie the game, a critical pitch by closer Jeff Hoffman allowed the Astros to secure the win. Blue Jays manager John Schneider attributed the loss to Hoffman's "one bad pitch" against Yainer Diaz.

titles: Trump appeals judge's order letting Cook stay on Fed board - Axios
Trump appeals order blocking him from firing Fed Governor Lisa Cook
summary: Former President Trump has appealed a judge's decision that allows Cook to remain on the Federal Reserve board. The Supreme Court is anticipated to resolve whether Trump has the legal authority to remove Cook.

title: US Lawmakers Unite in Condemnation of Violence, Lower Flags
snippets: Leaders from both parties condemn incident ‚Äî but shootings are now a feature of polarised America

US lawmakers, in bipartisan rebuke, say violence has no place in America as Trump orders flags lowered

  • Charlie Kirk shooting ‚Äì follow t
titles: Charlie Kirk‚Äôs killing and the ‚Äòdespicable violence‚Äô of US politics
‚ÄòDespicable‚Äô: Republicans and Democrats condemn violence after Charlie Kirk killing
summary: US lawmakers from both parties condemned an incident of violence, emphasizing that such acts have no place in America. This bipartisan stance came as President Trump ordered flags to be lowered, signaling a unified response to the incident. The condemnation reflects concerns about the increasing polarization in the country.

title: Sony Launches PlayStation Family App for Parental Controls
snippets: PlayStation is launching a new PlayStation Family app for iOS and Android to help parents manage their child‚Äôs playtime on PS5 and PS4. Parents can already set parental control features directly on a console, but this app gives parents another way to set limits and keep track of what their kid is pl
While Sony has long offered parental controls, the new app brings all of these tools into one dedicated place for easier access.
titles: PlayStation launches new app for parental controls
Sony rolls out new ‚ÄòPlayStation Family‚Äô parental controls app
summary: Sony has released a PlayStation Family app for iOS and Android, designed to help parents manage their child's playtime on PS5 and PS4. This app consolidates existing parental control features into one platform, allowing for easier access to set limits and monitor activity.

title: Zoox Begins Free Robotaxi Rides in Select Las Vegas Locations
snippets: Amazon's Zoox robotaxi unit is offering free rides in Las Vegas from a few locations, with plans to expand in the city.
Zoox's robotaxi can take riders to five destinations on The Strip. A spokesperson said most of the 50 robotaxis deployed will be in Vegas.
titles: Amazon's Zoox jumps into U.S. robotaxi race with Las Vegas launch
Amazon's Zoox launches robotaxi with free rides in Las Vegas. San Francisco is next.
summary: Amazon's Zoox robotaxi unit has started offering free rides in Las Vegas at select locations, with intentions to broaden its service in the city. While currently not a commercial operation, these complimentary rides mark the beginning of its service expansion.

title: TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 Set for SF, Focus on AI Voice Tech with ElevenLabs CEO
snippets: TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 is bringing together 10,000+ startup and VC leaders for three days of bold ideas, groundbreaking tech, and future-shaping conversations.

From audiobooks and dubbing to gaming and avatars, AI-generated voice is breaking into the mainstream ‚Äî and Mati Staniszewski, CEO and co-founder of ElevenLabs, is helping lead the charge. At TechCrunch Disrupt 2025, he‚Äôll take the stage to talk about what it takes to make voice AI truly human.
titles: Humanoids, AVs, and what‚Äôs next in AI hardware at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
Exploring the future of voice AI with Mati Staniszewski at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
summary: TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 will be held at Moscone West in San Francisco from October 27 to 29, attracting over 10,000 startup and VC leaders for discussions on innovative technology. A highlight will be Mati Staniszewski, CEO of ElevenLabs, discussing the advancement of AI-generated voice technology towards human-like quality.
